Chelsea have reportedly been told by former boss Carlo Ancelotti that they can sign Bayern Munich ace Mario Gotze for £35 million.

The Italian is taking over at the Allianz Arena when Pep Guardiola leaves this summer, and doesn’t see the Germany international in his plans.

Liverpool have also been linked with the 23-year-old, but The Sun have revealed that the Blues are already in talks with the player’s representatives.

Gotze has struggled to make an impact for Bayern this season, managing one goal and four assists in a paltry 13 Bundesliga appearances.

With the England squad for Euro 2016 set to be announced, there has been fresh debate about who should be on the plane to France.

As with every international tournament, there is a wide range of opinions on which players deserve their place, which players are living off their reputation, and talk of potential wildcards and youngsters ready to make surprise names for themselves.

Whatever happens, Roy Hodgson is sure to be in for criticism from some sides, but he won’t be the first to deal with an equally hostile press and fanbase.

Days before the end of the Premier League season, there already seems to be movement in the transfer market.

Latest gossip sees positive news coming from Liverpool, Arsenal, Manchester United and Manchester City.

And we’ve rounded it all up for you right here…

Mario Gotze making enquiries about Liverpool transfer – report

Bayern Munich star Mario Gotze has been making enquiries about joining Liverpool this summer.

The Germany international has been strongly linked as a top target for his old manager Jurgen Klopp in recent times.

Gotze looks likely to be out of the first-team picture at Bayern next season, and seems open to a switch to Anfield.

There’s encouraging news from Arsenal fans after last year’s shambles in the transfer market.

The Gunners only signed one player last summer, bringing in goalkeeper Petr Cech from Chelsea – a fine signing in itself, but not enough for Arsene Wenger’s side’s needs.

Still, it looks like work has already begun on improving the side this summer…

Arsenal want N’Golo Kante deal before Euro 2016 – report

Mesut Ozil is on the cusp of becoming Arsenal’s first ever player to earn £200,000-a-week, according to reports.

The German international currently has two years remaining on his £140,000 contract but has had doubts cast over his future following yet another disappointing season for Arsenal.

Given the pressure on Arsene Wenger, the Mirror’s John Cross has claimed that the French boss is confident Ozil will commit his future to the club by signing the new deal this summer.

Former Ajax manager Frank de Boer is ‘interested in the Everton job’, according to his brother Ronald.

De Boer, who left Dutch side Ajax yesterday after failing to secure the Eredivisie title on the final day after a 1-1 draw with De Graafschap – a team sitting second bottom of the division

The last-day result meant that Ajax handed the title to PSV Eindhoven in the most dramatic of turn of events.

Liverpool midfielder Philippe Coutinho was named Liverpool’s Player of the Season for the second year in a row.

The little Brazilian scooped an astonishing FOUR awards at Liverpool’s end of season awards evening, a reward for yet another superb campaign in what has proved a turbulent one with the sacking of Brendan Rodgers.

As well as being name Player of the Season, Coutinho won Player’s Player, Goal of the Season and Performance of the Season for his display in Liverpool’s 4-1 win away at Manchester City.

Arsenal are being linked with a £20million bid for Leicester City midfielder N’Golo Kante.

Sir Alex Ferguson has described the tireless midfielder as one of the best players in the league this season – and he’s not wrong.

But, although it may seem ridiculous, I do not think the Gunners should try and sign the Frenchman this summer.

At £20m (his rumoured release clause) Kante represents brilliant value in an often-overpriced transfer market.

But is he the type of player Arsenal need?

Kante’s industrious work ethic would be welcome, but he doesn’t give the team the physical playmaker that we currently lack.

The 23-year-old chose Madrid over Manchester in 2012 and cited the Red Devils’ signing of Phil Jones just weeks earlier as the main reason why he didn’t move to Old Trafford.

Roberto Martinez has finally been sent packing by Everton, sacked after a dismally underwhelming campaign.

The Spaniard arrived on Merseyside in 2013 with a reputation for attempting flowing, attractive football, having guided Wigan to an unlikely FA Cup victory.

But despite Everton aiming for European football this season after signing Romelu Lukaku, Oumar Niasse and Ramiro Funes Mori on big money deals in recent years, the highest the Toffees can finish is 11th place.

Supporters have grown frustrated at the side’s defensive frailties, and the general inconsistency from the side – especially after enduring a 4 – 0 thrashing from arch rivals Liverpool in last month’s derby.

Manchester United could be clear to seal the transfer of Barcelona’s Neymar after a shock revelation about a bust-up involving the Brazilian.

Catalonia-based football journalist Javi Miguel revealed that Neymar was involved in a furious row with team-mate Javier Mascherano.

The war of words was due to the Brazilian attacker’s ‘selfish play’, Miguel told radio programme ‘El Club de la Mitjanit’.

Mascherano rounded on his team-mate in the wake of Barcelona’s Champions League quarter-final exit at the hands of Atletico Madrid.

‘Stop being so selfish,’ the Argentina international is alleged to have yelled at Neymar before adding: ‘Think more about the team’.

Arsenal are prepared to make an offer for Real Madrid ‘s James Rodriguez in the summer transfer window, according to reports in Spain.

Rodriguez moved to the Bernabeu for £63million back in 2014 after an incredible World Cup with Colombia but has struggled for game-time this season at Madrid.

AS say the 24-year-old could be tempted to move on at the end of the season and the Gunners are ready to make a bid to land the £120,000-a-week midfielder.

It’s understood Manchester United, Manchester City and Chelsea are also considering moves for Rodriguez this summer.

Bastian Schweinsteiger may not have played for Manchester United for two months but he looks pretty ready for battle in this new commercial.

Promoting the mobile game ‘Clash of Kings’, the German World Cup winner has been filmed sporting a beard and king’s armour as he prepares to go into battle with a medieval army.

The commercial, shot in Manchester by DCMN, starts with Schweinsteiger walking his army into battle, only to be brought back to reality by the sound of a lawn mower.

He then finds himself in a football stadium, playing the game on his phone.

Everton have postponed their end of season awards due to Roberto Martinez being sacked.

The club released a statement explaining that it would be disrespectful to carry on with the ceremony in the circumstances.

The event, which was due to take place tonight, has now been pushed back until some time before the start of next season.

Everyone who had planned to attend the event will be notified with details once it has been rearranged.

Here’s the full statement from the club:

Tthe Club’s End of Season Awards, due to be held at St George’s Hall tonight, has been postponed. pic.twitter.com/W7OiRl0V6Q

At 34, any regular footballer’s career is beginning to peter out but Zlatan, obviously, is no ordinary player…the guy is superhuman.

The Paris Saint-Germain and Sweden talisman will leave the Stade de France at the end of the season and a number of elite European clubs are still after him.

Sami Hyypia has left FC Zurich after the 12-time Swiss champions slipped to the bottom of the Super League after seven games without a win.

Former Liverpool man Hyypia, who was appointed manager of Zurich in August, was booed by the fans after his team suffered a humiliating 4-0 defeat at home to Lugano in what can be only considered a relegation 6-pointer.

The defeat means Zurich, who were in the Europa League group stage just last season, slumped to the bottom of the division one point behind Lugano with just three games remaining.

Arsene Wenger has one year left on his current Arsenal deal and he’s going nowhere.

To the dismay of many, even those who count themselves amongst the more reasonable of the people who are screaming for Wenger’s removal, he will certainly be at the helm of the club next season.

But what of the year after that?

Media reports would have you believe that the Arsenal board are trying to get Wenger to sign a new three-year deal.

They have no desire to go through what Manchester United have faced since Sir Alex Ferguson dropped his R-bomb on them.

Despite the fact Liverpool equalised in injury time the majority of Chelsea fans will not have been too disappointed to leave Anfield with a draw after their nightmare season.

The Blues lost their home game against the Reds earlier in the season and have been stuttering towards the end of the season over the last few weeks.

It was an important point of pride not to embarrass themselves against bitter rivals and Guus Hiddink’s side can be relatively pleased with the performance.

Here are five takeaways from this unimportant game for the Blues.

1) Fans love to see their side battle

Manchester United target Jose Mourinho’s return to management didn’t exactly go as planned.

The Portuguese coach took charge of a team of Fifa legends to face Mexico-All Stars in a charity match.

And his star-studded squad lost 9-8.

Despite having world-class stars such as Ronaldinho, Fabio Cannavaro, Marcel Desailly, Fernando Hierro, Clarence Seedorf, Dwight Yorke and Luis Figo at his disposal, Mourinho couldn’t guide his side to a victory.

The former Chelsea and Real Madrid coach, 53, might be concerned that he’s losing his touch after a poor season lost him his job at Chelsea.

Marc Wilmots has announced his 23-man Belgium squad for Euro 2016 and it is littered with Premier League stars.

The Red Devils have emerged as one of the strongest sides in Europe in recent years and they’re favourites to emerge from the tournament’s toughest group that includes Italy, Republic of Ireland and Sweden.

Arsenal and Tottenham may have received a huge transfer boost in the race to sign Michy Batshuayi, with Marseille confirming the forward will leave this summer.

The Belgian striker has been in superb form this season, scoring 22 goals and providing 9 assists in all competitions to spark interest from top clubs.

Marseille’s financial problems mean they are under big pressure to let Batshuayi go, and caretaker manager Franck Passi says it’s clear he’ll be sold.

Roberto Martinez’s three-year reign as Everton boss has today come to an end.

Toffees chairman Bill Kenwright gave the Spaniard his marching orders after a disappointing third season on Merseyside.

The former Wigan and Swansea boss replaced David Moyes in 2013 following a historic FA Cup win with the Latics, and the Blues finished 5th in his first season.

However, having spent big on the likes of Romelu Lukaku and Oumar Niasse over the last two years, a return of a finish no higher than 11th this season is not acceptable for the board.

If you thought it was only footballers who wore garish footwear, think again.

Cyclist Sir Bradley Wiggins has posted his new ‘Wham Rickenbacker’ tribute shoes for next week’s Tour of California.

Fans of the pop art movement will recognise them as a section of Roy Lichtenstein’s ‘Wham!’ painting from 1963.

But Wiggins’ shoes are actually intended as a tribute to Paul Weller.

The Jam frontman used a Lichtenstein-inspired Rickenbacker guitar in the past and Wiggins is a huge fan of Weller.

Whether others are fans of the shoes, is another question…

MORE: Watch: huge pile-up at cycling race

After an excruciating few weeks, Everton have finally done the right thing and relieved beleaguered manager Roberto Martinez of his duties.

The Toffees’ decline under the Spaniard began steadily but accelerated markedly in recent weeks, culminating in three dismal away performances at Liverpool, Leicester City and Sunderland.

Throw in the worst home record in the club’s history and it is almost a surprise the board have taken so long.

Brazilian right-back Dani Alves proved he is a top class in every sense by including a disabled fan in Barcelona’s pre-match team photo.

Alves first spotted the young supporter, named Carlos, sitting next to his girlfriend, model Joana Sanz, while watching the Spanish side warm-up at the Nou Camp.

And when the team came out for the start of the La Liga clash against Espanyol, the cultured star came over to introduce himself.

But as is the way with the Catalan entertainers, Alves went a step further to ensure Carlos – who is blind and has mobility difficulties – would enjoy a night he will never forget.

The defender lifted the fan from his wheelchair and carried him to be part of the team photo, before returning him to his seat.

Borussia Dortmund have confirmed the transfer of Rennes forward Ousmane Dembele ahead of the Premier League side Liverpool.

The 18-year-old has been a revelation in Ligue 1 this season, leading to interest from a host of top clubs around Europe.

Earlier this week, things looked good for Liverpool after news of positive talks held between the player and Reds boss Jurgen Klopp.
